zone.line: & the honey flowing fountains of the Muses
they these souls return to us, laden with the
sweetness of melody--andarrayedclo as they are they speak truth—
For indeed a poet is a thing ætherially light
winged & sacred, nor is he capable
of composing poetry before until he
becomes inspired & as it were mad,
or whilst any reason remains in
him. For whilst man yet a yet man yet retain
any portion of the thing called reason
he is utterly incompetent to produce
poetry or to vaticinate. Thus, those
who do not compose poetry who

like you, declaim
speak various & beautiful
& beau poetry upon any subject as
you upon Homer, are not enabled to
do so by art or study: but every
rhapsodist or poet,whether be he dythyrambic,encomiastic, hyporchem choral, epic, or iambic is capable in
proportion to his participation in
the divine influence, & to the degree
in which the Muse itself has
